s: Ileus is one of the more common suspected diagnoses in everyday clinical practice. The term can refer either to mechanical or to functional ileus. Any physician who takes care of patients can be confronted with these entities; thus, all should be ...

t: Ileus - StatPearls - NCBI Bookshelf
s: Ileus, also known as paralytic ileus or functional ileus, occurs when there is a non-mechanical decrease or stoppage of the flow of intestinal contents.[1][2] Bowel obstruction is a mechanical blockage of intestinal contents by a mass, adhesion, hernia, or some other physical blockage.

t: Adynamic ileus | Radiology Reference Article | Radiopaedia.org
s: October 10, 2024 - Adynamic ileus is the failure of passage of enteric contents through the small bowel and colon that are not mechanically obstructed; i.e. it represents a paralysis of intestinal motility. Clinical presentation Patients may be asymptomatic or pr...

t: Your Guide to Ileus: Causes, Symptoms, Treatments, and More
s: July 12, 2022 - Ileus occurs when there are problems with movement in the intestines. This guide includes information about causes, symptoms, treatments, and more.

t: Ileus | CommonSpirit Health
s: Ileus (adynamic or paralytic ileus) is a type of bowel obstruction that occurs when the intestines stop moving normally even though there is nothing blocking them. This prevents the digestion of food and the movement of waste out of the body. Ileus can also be called a nonmechanical bowel ...

t: What does an adynamic ileus mean? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 6): I haven’t heard the term before, but I imagine that it is another name for what doctors in England refer to as paralytic ileus. Adynamic comes from Greek and means “not moving” (Greek words can be turned into their opposite by prefixing it with “a” or “an”). Paralytic ...

t: Paralytic Ileus: Definition, Causes, Symptoms & Treatments
s: October 8, 2021 - Paralytic ileus occurs when the muscle contractions that move food through your intestines are temporarily paralyzed. Food gets trapped and creates a blockage.

t: Intestinal obstruction and Ileus: MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia
s: Intestinal obstruction is a partial or complete blockage of the bowel. The contents of the intestine cannot pass through it.

t: Postoperative Ileus: Background, Pathophysiology, Etiology
s: Ileus occurs from hypomotility of the gastrointestinal tract in the absence of mechanical bowel obstruction. Although the exact pathogenesis of ileus remains multifactorial and complex, the clinical picture appears to be transiently impaired propulsion of intestinal contents.
